00015 typedef struct DLinkNode_struct {
00016     struct DLinkNode_struct *next; 
00017     struct DLinkNode_struct *prev; 
00018     Generic atom; 
00019     struct DLinkList_struct *up; 
00020 } DLinkNode, *DNode; 
00022 typedef struct DLinkList_struct {
00023     DLinkNode *head; 
00024     DLinkNode *tail; 
00025     Generic atom; 
00026 } DLinkList, *DList; 
00028 EXTERN(DLinkNode *, dlinkNodeAlloc, (Generic atom));
00029 /*  Generic atom;       info for this node
00030  *
00031  * Returns a new initialized node.
00032  * `atom' is typically a pointer to the "owner" of the node,
00033  * eg. another structure containing the node.
00034  */

00047  * `atom' is typically a pointer to the "owner" of the node,
00048  * eg. another structure containing the node.
00049  * `node' is returned, for convenience.
00050  */

00104 
00105 EXTERN(void, dlinkPush, (DLinkNode *node, DLinkList *list));
00106 /*  DLinkNode *node;
00107  *  DLinkList *list;
00108  *
00109  * Pushes `node' onto the front of `list'.
00110  * If `node' is on another list when `dlink_push' is called, well,
00111  * the other list is trashed.  So don't do that.
00112  */
00113 
00114 EXTERN(void, dlinkAppend, (DLinkList *list, DLinkNode *node));
00115 /*  DLinkList *list;
00116  *  DLinkNode *node;
00117  *
00118  * Appends `node' to the end of `list'.
00119  * If `node' is on another list when `dlink_append' is called,
00120  * the other list is trashed.  So don't do that.
00121  */
00122 
00123 EXTERN(void, dlinkInsertAfter, (DLinkNode *afternode, DLinkNode *node));
00124 /*  DLinkNode *afternode;
00125  *  DLinkNode *node;
00126  *
00127  * Insert `node' into the list that `afternode' is on,
00128  * immediately after `afternode' in the list.
00129  * Preconditions:
00130  *  `afternode' should be on a list
00131  *  `node' should not be on any list
00132  */
00133 
00134 
00135 EXTERN(void, dlinkInsertBefore, (DLinkNode *node, DLinkNode *beforenode));
00136 /*  DLinkNode *node;
00137  *  DLinkNode *beforenode;
00138  *
00139  * Insert `node' into the list that `beforenode' is on,
00140  * immediately before `beforenode' in the list.
00141  * Preconditions:
00142  *  `beforenode' should be on a list
00143  *  `node' should not be on any list
00144  */
00145 
00146 EXTERN(void, dlinkJoin, (DLinkList *res, DLinkList *first, DLinkList *second));
00147 /*  DLinkList *res;
00148  *  DLinkList *first;
00149  *  DLinkList *second;
00150  *
00151  * Join two lists `first' and `second' end-to-end,
00152  * placing the result in `res'.
00153  * Preconditions:
00154  *  `res' need not be distinct from `first' or `second'
00155  * Postconditions:
00156  *  old contents, if any, of `res' are lost (not freed)
00157  *  `first' and `second' contain trash.  They should be
00158  *  re-initialized before any reuse.
00159  */
00160 
00161 EXTERN(void, dlinkRemove, (DLinkNode *to_pluck));
00162 /*  DLinkNode *to_pluck;
00163  *
00164  * Remove `to_pluck' from the list it is on.
00165  */
00166 
00167 EXTERN(bool, dlinkListEmpty, (DLinkList *list));
00168 /*  DLinkList *list;
00169  *
00170  * Returns true iff `list' is an empty list.
00171  */
00172 
00173 EXTERN(DLinkNode *, dlinkPop, (DLinkList *list));
00174 /*  DLinkList *list;
00175  *
00176  * Removes the first node from `list', and returns the popped node.
00177  * Returns NULLNODE if `list' is empty.
00178  */
00179

00194 /*  DLinkNode *node;
00195  *
00196  * Frees node and the atom field of the node.  `atom' is treated like
00197  * a pointer to a block of dynamic storage.
00198  */
00199 
00200 
00201 EXTERN(void, dlinkFreeNodes, (DLinkList *list));
00202 /*  DLinkList *list;
00203  *
00204  * `dlinkFreeNode' is called for every node in `list'.
00205  */
00206 
00207 EXTERN(void, dlinkFreeNodesAndAtoms, (DLinkList *list));
00208 /*  DLinkList *list;
00209  *
00210  * `dlinkFreeNodeAndAtom' is called for every node in `list'.
00211  */
00212 
00213 EXTERN(bool, dlinkInList, (DLinkNode *node, DLinkList *list));
00214 /*  DLinkNode *node;
00215  *  DLinkList *list;
00216  *
00217  * Returns true iff `node' is in `list'.
00218  */
00219 
00220 
00221 EXTERN(bool, dlinkGoodList, (DLinkList *list));
00222 /*  DLinkList *list;
00223  *
00224  * dlinkGoodList is used to verify the "goodness" of a list.
00225  * All next and prev links are checked, to determine if the list is
00226  * fully connected in both directions, and properly terminated.
00227  * This routine is of interest to those who either
00228  * doubt the correctness of the list routines in this file,
00229  * suspect that they may be using these routines incorrectly,
00230  * or suspect that their lists are being trampled by some other routine.
00231  * It is, or course, a fairly expensive call.
00232  */
00233 
00234 typedef FUNCTION_POINTER(int, DLinkApplyFunc, (DLinkNode *node));
00235 EXTERN(void, dlinkApply, (DLinkList *list, DLinkApplyFunc func));
00236 /*  DLinkList *list;
00237  *  dlink_apply_func func;
00238  *
00239  * Applies `func' to every node in `list'.  That is, for every node in the
00240  * list, `func' is called, with the node passed as an argument to `func'.
00241  */
00242 
00243 typedef FUNCTION_POINTER(int, DLinkApply1Func,
00244  (DLinkNode *node, Generic arg1));
00245 EXTERN(void, dlinkApply1,
00246  (DLinkList *list, DLinkApply1Func func, Generic arg1));
00247 /*  DLinkList *list;
00248  *  dlink_apply1_func func;
00249  *  Generic arg1;
00250  *
00251  * Applies `func' to every node in `list', passing `arg1' as the second
00252  * argument to `func'.
00253  */
00254 
00255 typedef FUNCTION_POINTER(int, DLinkApply2Func,
00256  (DLinkNode *node, Generic arg1, Generic arg2));
00257 EXTERN(void, dlink_apply_2,
00258  (DLinkList *list, DLinkApply2Func func, Generic arg1, Generic arg2));
00259 /*  DLinkList *list;
00260  *  dlink_apply2_func func;
00261  *  Generic arg1;
00262  *  Generic arg2;
00263  *
00264  * Applies `func' to every node in `list', passing `arg1' as the second
00265  * argument to `func', and `arg2' as the third.
00266  */
00267 
00268 typedef FUNCTION_POINTER(DLinkNode*, DLinkMatchFunc,
00269  (DLinkNode *node));
00270 EXTERN(DLinkNode *, dlinkMatch,
00271  (DLinkList *list, DLinkMatchFunc func));
00272 /*  DLinkList *list;
00273  *  dlink_match_func func;      match function
00274  *
00275  * Apply `func' successively to each node of `list' (see `dlinkApply'),
00276  * until an application returns a value other than NULLNODE.  This value is
00277  * then returned, without applying `func' to the remaining nodes in `list'
00278  */
00279 
00280 typedef FUNCTION_POINTER(DLinkNode*, DLinkMatch1Func,
00281  (DLinkNode *node, Generic arg1));
00282 EXTERN(DLinkNode *, dlink_match_1,
00283  (DLinkList *list, DLinkMatch1Func func, Generic arg1));
00284 /*  DLinkList *list;
00285  *  dlink_match1_func func;     match function
00286  *  Generic arg1;
00287  *
00288  * `dlinkMatch1' is `dlinkMatch' as `dlinkApply1' is to `dlinkApply'
00289  *
00290  * Apply `func' successively to each node of `list' (see `dlinkApply1'),
00291  * passing `arg1' as a second argument,
00292  * until an application returns a value other than NULLNODE.  This value is
00293  * then returned, without applying `func' to the remaining nodes in `list'
00294  */
00295 
00296 #define NULLNODE (DLinkNode *)0
00297 #define NULLLIST (DLinkList *)0
